Description: Ostracon, large section of the shoulder and neck of a red-brown pottery grooved vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of two red-painted Coptic characters, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394326) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394326)
